programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes that his instincts will put him back in profit, while Dave has trouble finding anything worth bidding for.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is embarrassed when a woman tries to sell her husband's Playboy collection, and Corey considers buying a crossbow that has not been fired in almost 40 years.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers are tempted to buy a 1979 Kiss pinball machine, and Rick is stumped when a woman brings in a 1914 $20 bill with an unusual serial number. Chumlee tries to scrape together the cash to purchase a classic Harley-Davidson Shovel-head motorbike before the Old Man sells it.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick sets the team a challenge when Kelly organises a car show at the shop. The team also works on restoring a famous railway sign.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick sends his staff to a famous street market, and expects them to come back with something special. A client brings a rare 1930s telephone box into the workshop.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: Detectives investigate the murder of two women in Minnesota. The evidence points to a serial killer, but they wonder whether the deaths are linked or just a sinister coincidence.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Police go on the hunt for a killer when the leading advocate for the controversial science of cold fusion is beaten to death.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores an antique apple vending machine and a 1920s floor sander.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is excited when a 1950s toy car is brought into the shop, while Ron, Tyler and Brettly hunt for bargains.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick Harrison splashes out on the Mafia favourite, a 1962 Lincoln Continental with 'suicide doors', but extensive repair bills cause tension between him and the old man. A customer brings in a billfold from 1857 filled with Confederate money he found while cleaning out his garage, and the staff have a chance to buy a guitar that was played at a birthday party for Al Capone.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man looks to buy a baseball signed by 1951 World Series Champions the New York Yankees, but first needs to verify its authenticity. The team also appraises a rare $20 bill, a stuntman's driving suit, a piano and a KISS pinball table, while Chumlee is delighted when a Harley-Davidson is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, investigating whether a covert manual could prove the US government is hiding extra-terrestrial secrets.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists investigate a depiction of a stegosaurus found at Angkor Wat in Cambodia, comtemplating whether it suggest that alien species killed off the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team considers buying a mysterious 17th-century treasure chest that no one has yet managed to open.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff are offered an aeroplane propeller linked to aviator Charles Lindbergh, and a key ring alleged to have belonged to singer Willie Nelson.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head to Torrance and compete over an unusual unit that may prove to be one of the most valuable in the series' history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: At auctions in Bellflower, Ivy prays he can salvage something from a bad purchase. Meanwhile, Jarrod buys a unit that proves a nightmare for Brandi..

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: For the Benefit of Mr Charles
programme.desc: Mary brings a mysterious friend to an auction, and Jenny adopts a bold new strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction season ends with a record-breaking sale, and Moe chooses the one purchase his wife allows him to make each year.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked to forge J Nielson's favourite blade, a Damascus European dagger, before moving on to the Zande spear.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers are offered a 1941 Philco Radio, Rick Harrison tries to refurbish and sell a vending machine from the 1950s, while Corey authenticates an 18th-century flintlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A man trades a 1750 blunderbuss for an engagement ring, and an ejector seat from a Second World War fighter plane is offered to the team. Documentary following the work of staff at a pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Rumour has it that UFO witnesses have been intimidated into remaining silent about their experiences by mysterious 'Men in Black'. This documentary questions the identity of these ominous enforcers and who they might be working for.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate Puma Punku, the 14,000-year-old complex of interconnecting blocks in western Bolivia, and present computer analysis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the Old Man try to buy one of America's most valuable race cars - a 1965 Shelby Cobra - and become interested in a clock from a Second World War ship.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man faces a tough decision when the shop is offered a bottle of Prohibition-era whiskey, Corey buys a hot-air balloon, and a customer tries to sell a classic guitar.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Minnesota and challenge Danielle to sell a fibreglass cowboy boot they bought more than a year previously.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Al and Gord are called out to deal with a semi teetering on the edge of a 300-foot drop. Jamie gives a new driver a chance, but discovers he may be in over his head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head to Torrance and compete over an unusual unit that may prove to be one of the most valuable in the series' history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: At auctions in Bellflower, Ivy prays he can salvage something from a bad purchase. Meanwhile, Jarrod buys a unit that proves a nightmare for Brandi..

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts a 2011 edition of the comedy quiz, as stand-ups Milton Jones and Seann Walsh, The Thick of It's Chris Addison and Greg Davies from The Inbetweeners join panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to offer opinions on the past week's world events.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc, comedian Bob Mortimer, Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Westlife singer Kian Egan are this week's guests, whose stories include licking David Bowie's cake and being ordered to leave town by the police.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Judge Romesh dishes out justice for a rapper and a video producer locked in a bitter battle. Plus, a stark-naked accident has brought an ABBA tribute act to court.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A wife brings her husband to court over his obsession with a 'classic' car. Plus, warring neighbours resort to drastic measures to settle their constant rowing.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts a 2011 edition of the comedy quiz, as stand-ups Milton Jones and Seann Walsh, The Thick of It's Chris Addison and Greg Davies from The Inbetweeners join panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to offer opinions on the past week's world events.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Athletes take on daring stunts, with often hilarious results! Inspired by the sport of wakeboarding, Tim and Gendle invent a life-sized game of stone skipping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a man threatening to throw himself into a river, and Nadiene and Matt head out to a man with learning difficulties who is giving sheltered housing staff trouble.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look back at their best picks from the 1960s, including a meeting with Captain Kirk and a seat in the original Batmobile.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Poplar, East London, where Heavy D goes through his blue period after driving the other bidders up the wall with his antics.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Leamington Spa, and the up-market town brings out the businessman in Heavy D who gets more than he bargained for in one auction.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: The guys take a trip down memory lane when they look back at their grooviest picks from the disco decade..

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look back on their trickiest excavations ever, including relics buried underground and awesome finds trapped under mountains of junk.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The staging of the Aintree Grand National sees the team working flat-out trying to get two new police motorbikes converted in time. Second-in-command Tony finds himself on the wrong end of a 4x4 challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motor racing driver Lewis Hamilton demonstrates his abilities on the test track, and Richard Hammond tries his hand in a Formula One car. Jeremy Clarkson and James May assess historic vehicles to establish which one pioneered the control layout used in modern cars, and singer-songwriter James Blunt is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police spot two men acting suspiciously, and a pursuit ensues. James and Anthony drive home a drunk man they found at the roadside.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve commits to the original build time to deliver the Villain Rat Rod in three weeks. With no sign of a transmission, it doesn't look like the crew will meet their deadline.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters and the Stig enter a 24-hour endurance race at Silverstone, which proves to be one of their toughest challenges to date. Plus, James May races against BMX bikers around Budapest in a Fiat 500 and Jeremy Clarkson test-drives the Ascari A10. Actor Keith Allen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes the BMW M3, Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG and Audi RS4 to Spain for a thorough test of performance. David Tennant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, James May drives a Jaguar XF and Richard Hammond wonders what happened to that ultimate symbol of 1960s grooviness - the beach buggy.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, writer and actor Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Comedian and actor Miles Jupp, chef extraordinaire Heston Blumenthal, actress Emilia Fox and funnyman Ed Byrne are this week's guests.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that may be the truth or may be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Rhod Gilbert and Hal Cruttenden, interior designer and former Dragons' Den investor Kelly Hoppen and TV host and number-cruncher Carol Vorderman.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Holly Walsh and Nikki Bedi join regular panellist Alan Davies, as host Sandi Toksvig finally gets round to a bit of procrastination. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. In the first episode, the Richardsons decide to throw a huge birthday party for their daughter, Elsie.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Cariad Lloyd and Paul Sinha join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig considers various phenomena. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Comedian and actor Miles Jupp, chef extraordinaire Heston Blumenthal, actress Emilia Fox and funnyman Ed Byrne are this week's guests.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel..

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates theories that Hitler faked his suicide at the end of the Second World War and may have escaped from his Berlin bunker.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The capture and subsequent suicide of Heinrich Himmler. One of Hitler's most feared allies, his earlier reign of persecution had resulted in the deaths of millions of people.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Highclere Castle, the setting used for TV drama Downton Abbey, including an insight into the lives of current residents Lord and Lady Carnarvon.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Stories of people who came close to losing their lives during the Second World War, beginning with tales about the Chindits, the army's elite jungle troops division who beat the Japanese in a daring mission.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Investigating the mysterious death of a youngster at an elite Glasgow school, Burke incurs the wrath of the local press and finds himself branded a bully for his rough tactics. Ross goes undercover and soon discovers links with the shady world of drug-dealing. Drama, starring Blythe Duff and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective takes on his most challenging case as he searches for Linda's father-in-law, with the only clue to his whereabouts being an incident on board a submarine 25 years ago. As the case takes a devastating turn, Wallander is plunged into the shady world of Cold War-era politics and faces a battle to protect his daughter. Final episode of the crime drama, starring Kenneth Branagh.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Fusiliers decide to go to a local brothel in Hong Kong, but the visit has unforeseen consequences. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colonel Fortune is worried about the prospect of merging with another regiment, and Second Lieutenant Kate Butler faces hostility from the Marines during an exercise.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An inferno sweeps through Sun Hill station in the aftermath of the explosion, giving Gabriel the chance to make good his escape, callously leaving Andrea trapped under fallen debris as the flames creep closer. Dale also faces a fiery demise in the burning building, while Jim struggles to accept the news that his friend Ken was killed instantly when the van blew up. Marilyn fights for life in hospital, a grief-stricken Reg at her bedside - and as he tearfully slips an engagement ring onto her finger, an ominous bleep from her cardiac monitor heralds a tragic end to their relationship.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane returns to Holby, and reveals that Ric will not be returning. Swallowing her pride, she asks Connie for her old job back. Tricia recovers from her reconstructive surgery, but finds she has developed an infection, while Carlos asks her to come to America with him. Jess goes into labour at work, but Zubin is too busy dealing with an emergency patient to be there. Owen is forced to step into the breach, but the delivery develops complications.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie and Baz's wedding day arrives at last, and four old faces join the friends to attend the shipboard ceremony, until an emergency call puts all hands on deck and threatens to ruin the happy couple's chances. First of a two-part story, guest starring Brenda Fricker, Clive Mantle, Cathy Shipton and Patrick Robinson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kezia and Smithy work together on a courier van hijack and soon get a result, but later find themselves in trouble for scaring one of Keith Durante's rape victims. James Tennant's fiancee turns up at the station with news that he has evidence of the whereabouts of his missing daughter Amy, but it's clear that seven months of frantic searching have left him a broken man.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur gets a mysterious package and Ian visits Cindy, but fails to uncover her secret. Mandy sees a new side to Tricky Dicky.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Just when Pauline thinks things are getting back to normal with Arthur she makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The fire-fighting team faces a race against time as it struggles to save a girl trapped in a silo. Meanwhile, Bayleaf is sent up a crane to talk a suicidal boy down.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Katrina continues to fight Kilwillie for the local council seat, while Archie and Lexie struggle to deliver a grouse in time for a special dinner at Archie's London restaurant.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Retired Scotland Yard detective Chief Superintendent Trenchard visits the island, supposedly on a fishing trip. However, it becomes apparent he is intent on harassingly local philanthropist Oliver Sutton, who he is convinced was behind an earlier robbery that seriously injured a colleague. Meanwhile, a disillusioned Jim plans a sabbatical. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy invites a special guest round for tea, whom his mother completely fails to recognise. Guest starring Paul and Linda McCartney.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Quite a few feathers are ruffled as Joe Maplin pays a secret visit to the camp and decides Gladys should be promoted to head Yellowcoat - prompting her to sew on some stripes to display her superior rank. With Ruth Madoc, Simon Cadell, Su Pollard and Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel settle down to enjoy a quiet evening, only to find themselves constantly disturbed by ominous noises from the empty house next door. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The women of the village are impressed by a series of fanciful tales told by a retired jewel thief about his larcenous exploits in the south of France. However, the scoundrel's skills are put to the test when Marina and Miss Davenport seek his aid in helping Auntie Wainwright crack a keyless safe. John Challis guest stars.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives investigate the death of a woman who has been killed in a hit-and-run incident. Suspicion falls on the man who found her body, but he denies ever having met her. Lynley and Havers visit the victim's estranged husband and son, neither of whom has seen her since she walked out after her daughter's murder 30 years previously. Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra takes drastic measures to prevent Jack exacting revenge on the hit-and-run driver who killed his wife. With the team's future under threat, she tries desperately to keep the truth about the incident from shady new recruit DS Karen Hardwick, while working on a 10-year-old murder case to restore the squad's reputation. Amanda Redman and Lynda Bellingham star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. DS Boyd is approached by a woman convinced her father's death in a car crash was not an accident or suicide, but something far more sinister. Intrigued by the evidence she has collected, he agrees to re-open the case, and with the help of forensic scientist Dr Frankie Wharton, investigates a third option not previously considered. Trevor Eve and Holly Aird star.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A Runcorn couple hope their contemporary garden makeover is worth the nine-month wait, and there is disco fever in the New Forest with an enlightening design for a big budget en suite. Linda Barker presents.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Carly is in court to claim 350 for various loans she made to her friend. Defendant Evija claims that there was no deadline attached to the loan and therefore she should be given more time to pay. Criminal barrister Robert Rinder presides over their conflicting causes.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Lucy, Anthony, Hilary and Sam pit their wits against the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity receives some life-changing news, Laurel comforts her son Arthur, and Marlon has hope at last.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity struggles to process everything, Marlon is overwhelmed and Arthur still feels betrayed.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Inside MI5: Keeping The UK Safe - Tonight
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo gains access to MI5, one of the world's oldest and most-renowned spy agencies. Filmed as London experienced two terror attacks at Fishmonger's Hall and Streatham, Tonight sees the engine room of the UK's fight against terror. Surveillance officers and investigators also discuss their secret work and its impact on their lives.

programme.title: Flesh and Blood
programme.desc: Vivien tries to dismiss her children's fears about Mark, even as serious doubts creep into her mind. Jake's chances of reconciling with Leila suffer a potentially fatal blow. Helen is desperate to patch things up with George, even as her career hangs in the balance. Drama, starring Francesca Annis and Imelda Staunton.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The final two diets to be put through their paces are the TwoChubbyCubs Diet in which fakeaways' are on the menu, and the trendy Collagen Diet, in which a bone broth plan claims to keep you fuller for longer. Sian Williams and Dr Ranj Singh present.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore talks to Piers about his career and personal life, including his spectacular fall from grace in the early 2000s when 31-year-old Stuart Lubbock was found dead in his swimming pool following a party at his home. Barrymore was never charged in relation to the death, but the controversy has dogged his career ever since and he has rarely been seen on television, besides a successful appearance in the 2006 edition of Celebrity Big Brother, where he finished as runner-up. He also talks about his close friendship with Princess Diana, the depths of his drug and alcohol addictions and the moment in which he came out as gay.

programme.desc: Part one of two. The Orange County team builds a Wolverine-themed bike for the University of Michigan children's hospital, and a custom vehicle for My Name Is Earl.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Bo put his 1970 Corvette into storage more than 30 years ago, so now the car needs a lot of work including a repair to vandalism that would break any car lover's heart.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the tough task of working on board the Star of India, the world's oldest merchant ship, where his tasks include tarring the rigging and greasing the mast.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The development and manufacturing processes behind the creation of pharmaceutical blister packs, deli slicers and weather vanes.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Bowler Hats/Solar Water Heaters/Sticky Buns/Electrostatic Speakers
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of bowler hats, solar water heaters, sticky buns and electrostatic speakers.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank Fritz jumps for joy as he and Mike Wolfe pick a recently closed toy museum that is ready to sell its collection of treasures.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including MIddlesbrough v Leeds United and Fulham v Swansea City.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard Pembroke, where he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Deep in cattle country, Anthony and Danielle tackle an urgent water-drilling job to replace a collapsed well. Plus, a cross country convoy of drag racing cars is off to Perth.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mechanic Edd China teams up with Mike Brewer to get a classic Saab 900 Turbo back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is invited to show some classic cars at a prestigious event, and hopes to get his Panhard Lavassor running in time to be included in the display.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a Ford Woodie collection on auction in California and takes a shine to a Falcon.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank Fritz jumps for joy as he and Mike Wolfe pick a recently closed toy museum that is ready to sell its collection of treasures.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Dan Mawhinney is in a race to airlift his stranded snow machine out of the frozen tundra, while Orville and Jackie James face their first winter alone in the wilderness.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The opilio crab season begins and the newly repaired Cornelia Marie is pushed hard by a dual storm system that almost claims two of the Time Bandit's crew.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Pressure mounts as the days get warmer. Meanwhile, after months of work without taking time to grieve his best friend's death, Zeke reaches his breaking-point.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles over a collection of medical antiques, visits a warehouse full of vintage Americana in Nottinghamshire, and takes a trip to a Scottish stately home.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Robbie prepares for the biggest house move in the family's career. Plus, Jason must transport a massive cargo into the Outback with only a narrow window of clear weather.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a 181 Thing from a collector, but is forced to dig deep for the purchase, meaning there is not much money left in the kitty for Edd China's repair job.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits Trinity Marine in Exeter, Devon, as he continues his UK-wide search for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Larry wants to drive his uncle's '59 Cadillac DeVille, but the car has spent decades baking in the sun. Plus, a 1960 Bel Air is still missing critical components.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How manufacturer Lea and Perrins concocts its famous Worcestershire sauce. Plus, the shredding of cars and the making of sarees.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the amazing, and massive, decorations on Mardi Gras carnival floats are created, how rock candy is twisted together, and a look at how dentures are made.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: When Robert O'Dubaine was found shot to death in 1993, an apparent gangland hit unravelled into a case of betrayal, which directed the FBI on a hunt for his fiancee Catherine Suh, a lethal temptress dubbed the Black Widow by the media.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police investigate two crimes of passion, one featuring a man who was shot dead in his home, and another in which a football player and his girlfriend were beaten to death.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The murder of Raymond Collin, whose body was found in a snow-covered truck in Timmins, Ontario, days after he was reported missing in November 1996. Police made a breakthrough in the case following another murder elsewhere in the state.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Erica Vassell, who disappeared after a party in Clewiston, Florida. When her brutally murdered body was found days later, friends were left in shock and fear.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A state trooper is shot after pulling over a van. Officers apprehend the culprit and discover weapons in the man's vehicle.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A race against time sees an AHS team battling to save a kitten trapped in a maze of underground pipes. Plus, a dog with a fatal injury is the centre of a shocking case.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate anxiously awaits her dog's test results. Dr Danni volunteers at a pop-up clinic, while Dr Alex has a house call check-up with a pig and her piglets.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Debbie and Carmel team up to sell dresses to sister brides, but one of them would rather work alone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer and her picky entourage return to the shop for a second look, while a bride clashes with her mother over her choice of a non-traditional gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Glamour girl Hannah hopes to get hold of a glitzy gown that could rival anything worn by the Kardashians, while doctor Eve longs to ditch her scrubs for an elegant lace dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called to Cairns Rainforest Station Nature Park to check on the broken jaw of Agro the crocodile, who has managed to kill all nine of the other crocs in his pond.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators discovers a household that is overrun by cats.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators look back at the most shocking cases of the series, and relive the stories of despair, neglect, rescue and hope.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades search the homes of former athletes Iwan Thomas and Danny Crates, in search of old items they can take away and transform to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How technology such as mobile phones, CCTV and cashpoints can help solve murder investigations.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of teenager Samantha Bonnell, who vanished after a row with her boyfriend at a Californian cinema in September 2005. She died in a road traffic accident later the same night, but having no identification on her lay unclaimed at the San Bernardino County Coroner's Office until the link with her missing persons case was made 19 months later.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 32-year-old Florida firefighter Brandy Hall, whose truck was found submerged at the bottom of a pond after she went missing in August 2006. There were traces of her blood inside the vehicle and a year later her backpack - minus her gun - was found in a canal. The FBI reviewed the evidence and decided Hall had likely been murdered, but the mystery of her fate remains.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Shana Grice was murdered after being stalked by her ex-boyfriend, Michael Lane. He denied involvement, but experts examined police videos to determine the truth.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: British version of the reality show about bridal shops.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Nana is Ghanaian royalty and is running out of time to find her wedding gown, while Claire seeks something simple for her Windsor Castle wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Best friends Alice and Katie go wedding dress shopping together. One wants a classical gown, and the other seeks a shorter frock to wear with trainers.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress that reflects her Pakistani and Cypriot heritage, while another customer wants a dress with a detachable skirt, despite her mother's disapproval.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride recovering from a serious illness looks for her perfect dress, while a customer and her mother disagree over whether to go modern or traditional.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a glittery gown, which may not be practical for a wedding in Cyprus, and a customer looks for a mermaid dress so she can renew her vows.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard gets to drive a 1940s steam engine, and visits a country house to look for more potentially valuable items.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades search the homes of former athletes Iwan Thomas and Danny Crates, in search of old items they can take away and transform to raise money for charity.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. At over 600lbs, Angie is trying to get to Houston to see Dr Now and get life-saving weight-loss surgery. However, a family conflict proves to be an obstacle.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A profile of Kieran Kelly, the London Underground Serial Killer, who targeted the vulnerable homeless community and was convicted of murdering three people between 1953 and 1983.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The crimes of Hannegret Donnelly, who battered husband Christopher to death with 78 visible injuries in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire. In court, it transpired she had been abusing him at home for years.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Mark Bridger: The Killer in the Village
programme.desc: The case of five-year-old April Jones, who in 2012 disappeared while playing with friends in a Welsh village. DS Andy John recalls the hunt for her killer, who turned out to be 46-year-old local man Mark Bridger.
